Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Clay Kohl Pot
Description: A clay kohl pot, with a neck, a body and a round base; the pot has only one handle and the other is missing. There are incised lines that encircle the neck. The body is decorated with embossed geometrical designs that flow round it. This kohl pot is rather unusual in form; it is made of pottery, a material that was generally used in a rural milieu. It served as a cosmetic item for women and was for everyday use.
